King Street Brewing Company.notes: King Street Brewing was founded in 2010 and has been bringing fine craft ales and lagers to the Alaska marketplace since August 2011. Six year round offerings (Czech Pilsner, IPA, Blonde, Amber, Irish Stout, and Bavarian Hefeweizen) are complimented with multiple seasonal offerings and barrel aged selections. A cozy 15 seat tasting room allows you to sample flights, drink pints and take growlers, kegs, cans and bottles to go. No kitchen, but you’re welcome to order in or bring your own! Their beer can also be found in pubs, restaurants, and specialty liquor stores from Kenai to Fairbanks.
King Street Brewing Company.address: 7924 King St Anchorage , Alaska , 99518-3058 United States

Midnight Sun Brewing Co..notes: To-Go Bar on ground level.  The kitchen in The Loft is now open, 11am - 8pm every day (Alaska state laws require breweries to be closed by 8pm). Their menu can be perused at their website. Remember, they are remaining licensed as a brewery only, not a brewpub, so per the State of Alaska, there is a 36 oz. on-site consumption limit per person, per day in the Loft.

St. Elmo Brewing Co..notes: Our bar, beer hall, and beer garden is a great place to spend your day. We’re open for lunch and dinner, six days a week. Great beer isn’t the only option. We also have pour-over coffee, housemade mineral water, and soda. And food! Our resident food truck serves amazing Asian drinking food: we’re talking sticky ribs, a Japanese Fried Chicken (JFC) sandwich, and truffle tater tots.
